Investigating the fraudster’s life, Laura Kolb finds a self-fashioning figure who both influenced the emergence of the English novel and serves as a strange precursor to our modern-day fascination with conwomen and counterfeits, like the heiress manqué Anna Delvey.

中国に世界で最も高い橋が開通しました。
高さは地上2,000フィート以上です。
峡谷の両側の移動時間が2時間から2分に短縮されます。

external.description: The world’s tallest bridge, which stands at more than 2,000ft above ground, has officially opened in China. Drone footage shared by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Sunday (27 September) shows the newly opened Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge, which stands above a gorge in the Guizhou province. Underneath the structure, a rainbow can be seen thanks to a “spectacular water curtain test”. The 2,890-metre-long structure, which took more than three years to complete, reduces travel time between the two sides of the canyon from two hours to two minutes. Last month, a team of engineers deployed 96 trucks to strategic points across the bridge to recreate heavy traffic conditions to ensure it would not buckle.
external.title: World’s highest bridge unveiled in China at over 2,000ft above ground

images.alt: The question of what AI can and can’t do is made very challenging to navigate by a frustrating tendency that I’ve observed among many commentators to blur the lines between types and levels of AI technology. Artificial Intelligence, like the allegorical Artificial Labor, is a huge and fuzzy category of technologies which includes everything from chess engines to search engines to facial recognition software to Boston Dynamics robot dogs to the operating system from Her. The set of tasks requiring intelligence, like the set of tasks requiring labor, is large and multifaceted.

record.text: Co-op Faces Heavy Financial Losses Following April Cyberattack #Coop #DataBreach #FinancialLoss

external.description:
The Co-operative Group in the United Kingdom has revealed the extent of the damage caused by the cyberattack it suffered earlier this year. In its interim financial report for the first half of 2025, the company announced an £80 million (about $107 million) drop in operating profit, attributing the decline directly to the April breach.

According to the report, the losses can be broken down into two areas: around £20 million spent on immediate recovery efforts and another £60 million lost in sales while core systems were out of service. The disruption also drove down overall revenue by £206 million ($277 million). Co-op expects recovery-related expenses to continue, with an additional £20 million likely to be recorded in the second half of 2025.




The Attack and Data Theft

In late April, Co-op had to take parts of its IT network offline after detecting suspicious activity. The incident was later confirmed to be the work of affiliates linked to Scattered Spider, operating in connection with the DragonForce ransomware group. Although the attack was stopped before files could be encrypted, the intruders managed to steal personal details of all 6.5 million members, including both current and past customers.

The U.K.’s National Crime Agency arrested four individuals between the ages of 17 and 20 in July in connection with the breach. The same suspects are also believed to have played a role in cyberattacks against other well-known retailers, including Marks & Spencer and Harrods, during the same period.




Operational Disruptions

The breach created major technical problems that forced Co-op to rebuild its Windows domain controllers, which are critical servers that manage access across its network. With automated systems unavailable, the group had to fall back on manual operations. Staff rerouted more than 350,000 product items to franchise partners and independent co-ops to help minimize the disruption. Discount vouchers were also offered to members during the outage.

Despite these efforts, the group experienced ongoing challenges, including shortages in certain product categories and steep drops in sales of items such as tobacco. The company explained that while the quick response reduced some of the damage, the weeks of system downtime and the loss of customer information took a substantial toll.




Financial Position 

Co-op emphasised that despite the losses, its overall financial position remains stable. The group has £800 million in available liquidity, which it says will allow it to continue operating without funding concerns while addressing long-term recovery. Executives stressed that the business remains focused on its broader goals even as it manages the fallout from the attack.

The April incident highlights how cyberattacks can have wide-ranging consequences beyond stolen data, disrupting daily operations, reducing consumer trust, and inflicting heavy financial costs. For Co-op, the road to recovery will continue into the second half of 2025.

Staff rerouted more than 350,000 product items to franchise partners and independent co-ops to help minimize the disruption. Discount vouchers were also offered to members during the outage.

Despite these efforts, the group experienced ongoing challenges, including shortages in certain product categories and steep drops in sales of items such as tobacco. The company explained that while the quick response reduced some of the damage, the weeks of system downtime and the loss of customer information took a substantial toll.




Financial Position 

Co-op emphasised that despite the losses, its overall financial position remains stable. The group has £800 million in available liquidity, which it says will allow it to continue operating without funding concerns while addressing long-term recovery. Executives stressed that the business remains focused on its broader goals even as it manages the fallout from the attack.

The April incident highlights how cyberattacks can have wide-ranging consequences beyond stolen data, disrupting daily operations, reducing consumer trust, and inflicting heavy financial costs. For Co-op, the road to recovery will continue into the second half of 2025.
external.title: Co-op Faces Heavy Financial Losses Following April Cyberattack

record.text: Gemini in Chrome: Google Can Now Track Your Phone #AI #ChatGPT #Cloud

external.description:
Is the Gemini browser collecting user data?



A new warning for 2 billion Chrome users, Google has announced that its browser will start collecting “sensitive data” on smartphones. “Starting today, we’re rolling out Gemini in Chrome,” Google said, which will be the “biggest upgrade to Chrome in its history.” The data that can be collected includes the device ID, username, location, search history, and browsing history. 

Agentic AI and browsers



Surfshark investigated the user privacy of AI browsers after Google’s announcement and found that if you use Chrome with Gemini on your smartphone, Google can collect 24 types of data. According to Surfshark, this is bigger than any other agentic AI browsers that have been analyzed. 

For instance, Microsoft’s Edge browser, which has Copilot, only collects half the data compared to Chrome and Gemini. Even Brave, Opera, and Perplexity collect less data. With the Gemini-in-Chrome extension, however, users should be more careful. 

Now that AI is everywhere, a lot of browsers like Firefox, Chrome, and Edge allow users to integrate agentic AI extensions. Although these tools are handy, relying on them can expose your privacy and personal data to third-party companies.

There have been incidents recently where data harvesting resulted from browser extensions, even those downloaded from official stores. 

The new data collection warning comes at the same time as the Gemini upgrade this month, called “Nano Banana.” This new update will also feed on user data. 

According to Android Authority, “Google may be working on bringing Nano Banana, Gemini’s popular image editing tool, to Google Photos. We’ve uncovered a GIF for a new ‘Create’ feature in the Google Photos app, suggesting it’ll use Nano Banana inside the app. It’s unclear when the feature will roll out.”

AI browser concerns



Experts have warned that every photo you upload has a biometric fingerprint which consists of your micro-expressions, unique facial geometry, body proportions, and micro-expressions. The biometric data included device fingerprinting, behavioural biometrics, social network mapping, and GPS coordinates.

Besides this, Apple’s Safari now has anti-fingerprinting technology as the default browsing for iOS 26. However, users should only use their own browser for it to work. For instance, if you use Chrome on an Apple device, it won’t work. Another reason why Apply is advising users to use the Safari browser and not Chrome.
external.title: Gemini in Chrome: Google Can Now Track Your Phone

record.text: Decentralized AI Emerges as Counterweight to Big Tech Dominance #AInews #Cryptocurrencies #Technology

external.description:
Artificial intelligence has undeniably transformed productivity and daily life, but its development has also concentrated power in the hands of a few corporations. Giants such as Google (Gemini), OpenAI (ChatGPT), X (Grok), and Anthropic (Claude) dominate the ecosystem, holding most of the computing resources, data, and top talent. 
This centralisation raises concerns about bias, privacy, and the unchecked influence of private firms over technologies that increasingly shape society.

Critics argue that centralised AI models collect and monetise vast amounts of personal and corporate data with little transparency. 
A Stanford University study in 2025 found users perceive large language models to lean politically left, while controversies have emerged around Grok allegedly producing antisemitic rhetoric and Gemini misrepresenting historical figures. 
Beyond bias, scaling constraints are evident, data centres already strain global electricity use and are projected to consume 20% of global power by 2030. Centralised systems also create single points of failure, making them attractive targets for hackers. 
In response, interest in decentralised AI is accelerating. Valued at $550.7 million in 2024, the sector is expected to reach $4.33 billion by 2034. Unlike traditional models, decentralised systems keep raw data on local devices, sharing only trained insights across networks secured by blockchain. 
This distributes control among participants rather than concentrating it with a single company.

The benefits are compelling. Individuals and organisations retain control over their data, deciding what to share. Training across a decentralised network introduces greater diversity of perspectives, reducing systemic bias. 
By distributing computation across devices, the model scales efficiently without relying on energy-hungry central servers. Security also improves without a central point of attack, blockchain adds resilience while much sensitive data never leaves the user’s device. 
Advocates link this shift back to early cypherpunk ideals. 
As Eric Hughes wrote in A Cypherpunk’s Manifesto, cryptography was meant to safeguard privacy and liberty in the digital age. While cryptocurrencies drifted toward profit-seeking, decentralised AI could represent a return to those original principles including rebalancing power, protecting privacy, and building a more sustainable digital future.
external.title: Decentralized AI Emerges as Counterweight to Big Tech Dominance

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Why Airport Food Is So Expensive?" on @Spreaker #business #economics #finance #money #personalfinance

external.description: The source provides an extensive explanation for the exorbitant cost of food within airports, citing a combination of economic and operational pressures. This high pricing is primarily driven by astronomical overhead expenses, including excessive rent, specialized labor costs due to security requirements, and complex logistics for supplying perishable goods within a secure environment. Furthermore, the episode emphasizes that airports constitute a captive market, where travelers have limited alternatives and are often time-constrained, enabling vendors to charge premium rates without facing significant competition. The source also notes that airport revenue models and traveler psychology, which often involves less price-sensitivity when traveling, contribute to the sustained high prices, while offering travelers suggestions like bringing their own food to mitigate the financial impact.
external.title: Why Airport Food Is So Expensive?

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Why Humans Living in Space Is Almost Impossible" on @Spreaker #cosmos #mars #nature #planets #science #space

external.description: The source provides an extensive argument detailing why permanent human habitation in space is currently almost impossible, despite long-standing dreams of space colonies. The discussion explores numerous complex hurdles, beginning with the hostile environment of space, citing issues like vacuum, extreme temperatures, and lethal cosmic radiation, which necessitate advanced and difficult-to-maintain engineered habitats. Furthermore, the episode addresses the physiological challenges presented by microgravity, which causes bone loss and cardiovascular damage, as well as significant psychological strains from isolation. Finally, the source emphasizes the massive logistical, technological, and economic barriers associated with achieving self-sufficiency in resources, overcoming astronomical launch costs, and managing the ethical implications of such a monumental undertaking.
external.title: Why Humans Living in Space Is Almost Impossible

"Your Brain Isn't LAZY: A Practical Guide to 'Task Initiation Paralysis'" on @Spreaker #2minuterule #adhd #adhdhacks #adhdparalysis #atomichabits #bodydoubling #executivedysfunction #focus #getitdone #howtoadhd #lifehacks #mentalhealth #neurodivergent #podcast #procrastination

external.description:
Ever stare at a task you know you need to do, but your brain just... won't? That crushing feeling of being stuck before you even start has a name: task initiation paralysis. You've probably heard the famous advice: "Just do it for two minutes!" But what if that famous 2-Minute Rule is actually making your procrastination worse?

Welcome to the definitive takedown—and rebuilding—of the world's most popular productivity hack. We're exploring the two very different versions of the rule from habit gurus James Clear and David Allen, and exposing the hidden dangers of applying it incorrectly, like constant task switching and a false sense of progress.

This episode is your toolkit for breaking through that mental wall, especially if you struggle with ADHD or executive dysfunction. We're diving into brain-changing alternative strategies that actually work: the power of breaking tasks into absurdly small micro-steps, the science behind body doubling, and how a simple "system reset" can conquer cognitive friction and finally get you moving. Stop fighting your brain and start working with it.

Ready to finally break the cycle of getting stuck? Hit play, and if this unlocks something for you, share it with a friend who's stuck on the starting line. Don't forget to follow and leave a 5-star review to help us defeat procrastination together!
external.title: Your Brain Isn't LAZY: A Practical Guide to 'Task Initiation Paralysis'

external.description:
Ever leave a conversation feeling confused, exhausted, and somehow... in the wrong, but you can't pinpoint exactly why? That's not an accident. It's a strategy.

Welcome to your masterclass in psychological self-defense. This podcast shines a harsh light into the shadows of emotional manipulation, exposing the invisible tactics toxic people use to control you. We're not talking about obvious aggression; we're talking about the subtle, crazy-making poison of gaslighting, strategic silence, and backhanded praise that leaves you riddled with guilt and self-doubt.

We’re tearing up their playbook. You will learn to spot the subtle signals—the constant interruptions, the weaponized sarcasm, the expertly-timed guilt trips—and understand the game being played.

But this isn't just about identifying the problem; it's about equipping you with a shield. We'll give you four practical, easy-to-use defense techniques to deploy in real-time, including how to use silence to flip the power dynamic and how to calmly repeat your point until their tactics fall apart.

If you're ready to trade confusion for clarity and reclaim your power in every conversation, hit that subscribe button. It's time to get tactical.

"The Machine That Builds the GOD Machine" on @Spreaker #agi #ai #aichips #aiinfrastructure #aisenergyproblem #artificialintelligence #computepower #datacenters #elonmusk #energyconsumption #futureoftech #innovation #nuclearenergy #nvidia #openai #powergrid #samaltman #technology

external.description:
Forget the code. The future of Artificial Intelligence won't be written in Python; it will be built with steel, silicon, and nuclear power.

Welcome to the podcast that exposes the best-kept secret of the AI revolution: the software is a ghost, but the machine is a monster with an insatiable appetite for energy. We're taking you behind the headlines of OpenAI and Nvidia to reveal the shadow war being fought for compute power—the real currency of the 21st century.

You'll hear how titans like Elon Musk and Sam Altman aren't just building algorithms; they're planning to harness terawatt scales of electricity, equivalent to the output of entire nations, just to power the next generation of AI infrastructure. We'll deconstruct Altman's audacious plan to build a "machine that builds machines"—a factory that churns out a gigawatt of new data centers every week.

This is a story of brutal physics meeting exponential ambition. We'll investigate the crippling scarcity of AI chips, the monumental challenge of scaling our power grid, and why figures like Altman are now pouring billions into next-generation energy companies like Helion Energy. This isn't just about smarter AI; it's an arms race for the planet's power.

If you're ready to understand the unseen physical foundation upon which our digital future is being built, hit that subscribe button. The real revolution isn't happening on your screen; it's happening in our power plants.
external.title: The Machine That Builds the GOD Machine

record.text: Elon Musk Becomes the First Person to Reach a $500 Billion Net Worth #elonmusk #tesla #xai #spacex #billionaire #networth #technology

images.alt:
Elon Musk has achieved a historic milestone by becoming the first individual to surpass a net worth of $500 billion, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires Index. This remarkable feat was propelled by a resurgence in Tesla's stock price, which has risen over 14% this year, and the increasing valuations of Musk's other ventures, including xAI and SpaceX. On the day of the announcement, Tesla's stock gained 3.3%, adding more than $6 billion to Musk's wealth. Holding a 12.4% stake in Tesla, Musk's fortune is closely tied to the company's performance. In a show of confidence, Musk recently purchased $1 billion worth of Tesla shares, signaling his commitment to the company's future. Despite challenges such as declining auto sales and profit pressures, Tesla continues to be a significant contributor to Musk's financial success. His AI startup, xAI, was valued at $75 billion in July and is speculated to be targeting a $200 billion valuation, though Musk has denied active fundraising efforts. Additionally, SpaceX is reportedly aiming for a $400 billion valuation. Musk's achievement underscores the growing influence of technology-driven wealth in the global economy.
Reuters

record.text: Microsoft Slashes Game Pass Ultimate Price Hike: What You Need to Know #xbox #xboxgamepass #gamepassultimate #gamingnews #videogames

images.alt:
Microsoft had initially announced a steep 50% price hike for its flagship subscription, Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, raising monthly costs from $19.99 to $29.99. The move sparked widespread criticism from the gaming community, with many fans voicing concerns over affordability and value. In response to the backlash, Microsoft has now decided to hold off on the full increase, keeping the service at its current price point for the time being.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate has long been celebrated as one of the best deals in gaming, offering subscribers access to hundreds of console and PC titles, day-one releases from Xbox Game Studios, EA Play integration, and cloud gaming. With its all-in-one model, the subscription has been central to Microsoft’s strategy of expanding its gaming ecosystem and building long-term engagement across platforms.

record.text:
25 years into a computing career "maybe I should have kept this as a hobby & learned plumbing at college"

the last few years have definitely gotten worse
涼しくなってきたのでアクアパッツァなど作りましたの。あとカツオのカルパッチョ。バジルが120円で売られてる奇跡が発生してたので、レシピ無視でバジル山盛りである。

こう、法律を見てると、そのルールの意義はわかるが当事者的にはちょっと変な気分では、みたいなのが気になると先に進めない性分で、とはいえ仮定の話に人を突き合わせるのも気が引けるのでAIに適当に回答させて一旦溜飲を下げることがあるのね。

その手のちょっとした事を会社が囲ってるChatGPTと個人的に契約してるCopilotに同じように投げたら、前者は、結局は組織の都合だ、当事者のお気持ちなんてしらねーよ、みたいな回答で、後者はそう思うかもしれないけどこんな考え方もあるよ、みたいな回答で、お前...いいやつだな...とついにAIに情を感じてしまった。チョロすぎる。これはいかん。
この作家さん、すごすぎないか。初めて読むのだけど、作品紹介に「不世出の才能」と書かれる程度には寡作のようだ。え、だって、絵もストーリーも良くて、ちょっとした台詞とか描写でその場の空気とか関係性が匂い立つように感じられるの、びっくりしてしまった。

Introduction to AI using Copilot

Tuesday 7th October

10am - 12pm

Online via teams

 

In today's rapidly changing business world, artificial intelligence (AI) is a game-changer. To stay competitive, understanding AI is essential. Microsoft Copilot offers a responsible and ethical approach to AI, prioritising transparency, privacy, and adherence to industry standards. As more than just an assistant, Copilot empowers productivity by streamlining tasks, from drafting emails to providing expert answers. Focus on what matters most while Copilot handles the rest.

Understanding AI: Define AI and its various types.
Mitigating Risks: Learn to identify and address potential risks associated with AI.

物体検出モデルの推論高速化入門
本記事は、EVERSTEEL社の「鉄ナビ検収AI」における物体検出モデルのCPU推論高速化をテーマに、実務上のニーズと具体的なアプローチを紹介する。
計算処理の最適化に焦点を当て、認識性能を保ったまま推論を効率化する手法として、PyTorchのコンパイル機能、メモリ形式の変更、BF16半精度推論、NMS設定の調整、およびONNX Runtimeなどの推論エンジンの活用法について解説している。

external.description: はじめに株式会社EVERSTEELで機械学習エンジニアをしている加藤です。機械学習システムの運用において、推論の高速化は重要な課題です。特にリアルタイムでの処理が求められるアプリケーションでは、レスポンス時間の短縮がユーザー体験に直結します。また、クラウド環境のコスト削減やエッジデバイスのリソース制約など、様々な観点から推論の効率化が必要とされます。本記事では特に物体検出モデルのCPU推論に焦点
external.title: 物体検出モデルの推論高速化入門

エンジニアになって1年目に読み終わった本を振り返る
入社1年目のバックエンドエンジニアが、この1年間に読破した書籍を振り返り、得た学びをまとめた記録である。
紹介された書籍は、プログラミング基礎、ソフトウェア設計、データベースといった技術書に留まらず、ビジネススキル、チームマネジメント、課題解決に関するものなど多岐にわたる。
実務に直結する知識を幅広くインプットし、継続的な自己成長を目指す学習意欲と姿勢を読者に伝えている。

浮動小数点数に1を掛ける操作は最適化できるか／浮動小数点数のビット列表現のカノニカル性について
浮動小数点数に1を掛ける操作は数値的には恒等関数ですが、入力のビット列表現を変えるか検証しました。
IEEE 754の十進浮動小数点数では、1を掛けることで非カノニカルなゼロやその他の表現がカノニカルな形式に正則化され、ビット列表現が変化します。
また、signaling NaNもquiet NaNに変わります。
この結果は、数値的に「何もしない」演算であっても、ビット列表現の変化を考慮するコンパイラーは安易に最適化で消去できないことを示唆しています。

external.description: 浮動小数点数に1を掛ける関数を考えます：void multiply_one(double *x){    static const volatile double one = 1.0;    *x *= one;}数学的には、この関数は入力をそのまま返す関数（恒等関数）です。浮動小数点数の場合はどうでしょうか？特に、この関数は、入力として与えられた浮動小数点数のビット列表現を変えるでしょうか？多く

external.description: وافادت وكالة تسنيم الدولية للانباء ان  آية الله خاتمي تطرق في خطبتي الجمعة، إلى أهمّ محاور رسالة قائد الثورة (مد ظله العالي) المتلفزة، قائلاً: كانت رسالة قائد الثورة المتلفزة الأخيرة بالغة الأهمية، وتضمنت ثلاثة محاور أساسية. أولًا، تأكيده المتجدد على الحفاظ على الوحدة الوطنية واستمرارها، حيث قال: "واعتصموا بحبل الله جميعًا ولا تفرقوا". هذه الوحدة هي نفس الوحدة المقدسة في القرآن الكريم التي يجب الحفاظ عليها. وأضاف : أما النقطة الثانية، فكانت مسألة تخصيب اليورانيوم. فقد أكّد قائد الثورة بوضوح أن التخصيب ضرورة حتمية للبلاد. ولا يقتصر هذا الموضوع على الجانب النووي أو الدفاعي فحسب، بل يلعب دورًا حيويًا في مجالات مثل الطب والزراعة والبيئة وغيرها.
external.title: خطیب جمعة طهران: إذا أراد الاعداء مهاجمتنا، فسنحرث تل أبیب وحیفا- الأخبار ایران

He usado Copilot para resolver los cursos de obligado cumplimiento del curro. Para esto la IA si tiene sentido.
Yo te ayudo con la gestión, señor ocupado

それはつまり、Microsoft Office が爆発的に世界に広がった頃から、ビジネスとセキュリティの概念が変化したことを意味している。
より緩くかつ貪欲になっている。

Copilotは既存のMicrosoft製品に適用できるように後付けで開発されたものなので、全般にAIとの連動が「建て増し」的な歪な不完全さが目立つね。
長期的には、AIと連動した別の会社のオフィスツールが出回れば、牙城を崩されるかもしれないな🤔

知事とか市長とかの首長や議員が高い倫理観が求められる、とメディアとかインフルエンサーの皆さんとかが言うのが良くわからない。仕事をちゃんとやってくれれば、刑法にひっかからなければ、我々と同じでいいと思いますけどね。裁判官ならいざ知らず。
人間に象徴を求めるからそういうおかしなことになる。天皇じゃあるまいし。てか人間を象徴にする日本国憲法はおかしいですが。
Le dije que iba a insultar a la IA en cada prompt y me animó a ello.

No obstante, le he dicho claramente y con confianza que me iba a quejar en redes sociales poniendo cosas como

ポストの概要
このX（旧Twitter）のポストは、@Ogwmc_kanana さん（小川町=大和・かなな）によるもので、2025年10月3日11:50（GMT）に投稿されたものです。内容は、東武鉄道の乗務員が制帽（帽子）を脱いで乗務しているのを目撃し、その理由を「直通先の東京メトロ、東急電鉄、相模鉄道などと同様に、制服着用規定がようやく緩和されたから」と推測・解説したものです。ポストには東武鉄道の公式プレスリリースPDFのリンクが2つ（重複）と、Misskeyのノートへのリンクが貼られています。

この投稿は、鉄道ファンらしい視点で日常の変化を観察し、業界のトレンドを共有する軽やかなトーンです。エンゲージメントは低め（いいね0、リポスト1、リプライ1、閲覧10）ですが、鉄道関連のニッチな話題として興味深いものです。

補足：東武鉄道の制服着用規定緩和の背景と詳細
東武鉄道は、従業員の心身の健康を支え、働きやすい環境を整えることで、高品質なサービスを提供することを目指しています。この取り組みは、2024年に策定された同社の長期経営ビジョンに基づく「人的資本強化」の一環で、従業員のエンゲージメント向上と生産性向上を目的としています。 直通先の東京メトロ（2023年頃から帽子着用任意化）、東急電鉄（2022年頃からネクタイ・帽子任意）、相模鉄道（2023年頃から同様の緩和）など、他社が先行して制服の柔軟化を進めてきた流れに、東武鉄道も追随した形です。これにより、鉄道業界全体で「働き方改革」が進んでおり、気候変動や個人の体調に配慮した柔軟なドレスコードが標準化されつつあります。

具体的な緩和内容（2025年10月1日実施）
制服の季節選択の自由化: 夏季用・冬季用の制服を、通年で従業員の気候や体調に合わせて選択可能に。従来は季節ごとに固定されていたものを、当日の状況に応じて柔軟に。
制帽（帽子）の着用任意化: 駅改札内や乗務員室内での着用を任意とし、ポストで観察された「脱帽乗務」がこれを反映。
ネクタイの着用任意化: 通年で任意にし、快適性を優先。
靴の選択肢拡大: 従来の革靴に加え、黒・濃紺の低かかとスニーカーを許可。動きやすさを重視。
技術系職場の新素材導入: ミズノ製の吸汗・速乾性シャツ（ナビドライTシャツ/ポロシャツ）を軌道・電気・車両職場で本格導入。2024年度のテスト運用を経て、2025年度から全所属員対象。

追加の安全・健康対策
熱中症対策として、ファン付き作業服、ネッククーラー、偏光サングラス（スペーシアX運転士向け）などのアイテムを着用可能に。
これらは、安全性を損なわず、夏場の過酷な環境を緩和するものです。

解説：なぜ今、この変化？
日本の鉄道業界は、伝統的な制服文化が根強い一方で、近年はSDGsやダイバーシティの観点から柔軟化が進んでいます。東武鉄道の場合、伊勢崎線・日光線などの長距離路線で直通運転が多く、他社の乗務員と混在する機会が増えたため、統一感を保ちつつ個別対応を進める必要があったのでしょう。ポスト主の観察のように、乗客側からもこうした変化が「違和感」として気づかれ、SNSで共有されることで業界の進歩が可視化されます。将来的には、さらにカジュアル化（例: ポロシャツの標準化）が見込まれ、乗客の多様な価値観にも寄与するはずです。

このポストは、鉄道の「現場の声」を象徴するもので、ファン層の間で共感を呼ぶ可能性が高いです。もしさらに詳細な画像や動画があれば、追加で分析できます！

external.description: 最近、Steamプラットフォームで「成人向けゲームに関する無料アップデートが禁止された」という噂が広まりました。発端となったのは、インディー開発者Crimson Delight Gamesが自社ゲーム『Tales of Legendary Lust: Aphrodisia』に新しいNSFWコンテンツを無料アップデートで追加しようとしたが、Valveから有料DLC経由でのみ可能だと言われたという報告です。これがコミュニティで波紋を呼び、懸念が広がる中、『Project Werewulf』の開発者はこの噂を否定しました。彼は自らのゲームで無料アップデートを行った実績を挙げ、噂は事実無根であると主張しています。現状では、SteamのNSFWコンテンツの扱いに関してポリシーが不透明で、今後の動向が注目されています。

record.text:
Cometブラウザーが無料化、AI機能搭載でGoogle Chromeに挑戦 - AIゲームまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
AI検索スタートアップのPerplexityは、同社のAI搭載ウェブブラウザー「Comet」を、7月のMaxプラン登録ユーザー向けから無料化し、誰でも利用可能にしたと発表しました。  
Cometは、リリース以来「インターネットで最も人気のあるブラウザー」とされ、数百万人がダウンロード待ちの状態にあるといいます。Google Chromeに挑戦する意図で、誰でも利用できるようになりました。  
Cometは、デフォルトの検索エンジンにPerplexity AIを採用し、AIによるページ要約や、ユーザーに合ったニュース、オンラインストアの最安値提示、旅行計画支援、資産管理などの機能を提供します。これらは「Comet Assistant」によって支援され、ユーザーの日常生活をサポートします。  
競合として、GoogleのChromeにGeminiの統合や、The Browser CompanyのAIブラウザー「Dia」、Operaの「Neon」も登場しており、競争が激化しています。  
また、Perplexityは有料機能「Comet Plus」も導入し、信頼できる出版社のコンテンツを提供するサブスクリプションサービスを開始しました。
external.title: Cometブラウザーが無料化、AI機能搭載でGoogle Chromeに挑戦 - AIゲームまとめ
